text: The Diocese of Vanuatu and New Caledonia is one of the nine current dioceses of the Anglican Church of Melanesia. It is one of the four original founding dioceses of the Church, erected in 1975Anglican Church of Melanesia — Diocese of Malaita (Accessed 4 September 2016) as the Diocese of the New HebridesAnglican Communion — Melanesian Messenger Online, November 4, 2004 (Archived 5 July 2007; archive accessed 5 September 2016) and inaugurated in 1975 at Lolowai on Aoba Island. The diocese's name was changed to the Diocese of Vanuatu , when the Republic of Vanuatu gained its independence; Footnote 47 the name was changed again, around 2010, to the Diocese of Vanuatu and New Caledonia.
